definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: This is my first journey by the through train to Guangzhou .
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次乘直达车去广州。

sentences.english: Be there a direct train for Wuchang?
There are many trains from Hangzhou to Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 这是从广州到上海的直达车。

sentences.english: There are through trains from Fuzhou to Nanjing and Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 从福州有直达车到南京和北京。

sentences.english: There is a through train from Guangzhou to Xi'an.
sentences.chinese: 从广州到西安有直达车。

sentences.english: It's a through train, you don't have to change anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 这是一趟直达车，你不需要在任何地方换车。

sentences.english: How much is the through train tick?

definition: to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
local bus or train/slow train with many stops
to take the car, bus, train etc
shuttle bus (or train)/train or bus traveling only part of its normal route
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
